name: Massaman Lamb Shoulder
keywords: Massaman Curry, Lamb Shoulder, Thai Cuisine, Slow Cooked Lamb, Potatoes, Coconut Milk, Cinnamon, Star Anise, One-Pot Meal, Comfort Food, Rich Flavor, Aromatic Spices, Easy Recipe, Family Meal, Autumn Recipes, Winter Recipes, Festive Food, Curry, Braised Lamb, Oven-Baked, Savory
description: A flavorful and tender Massaman Lamb Shoulder recipe featuring slow-cooked lamb with potatoes in a rich coconut milk and Massaman curry sauce, infused with aromatic spices like cinnamon and star anise.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 220C. Whisk the curry paste, coconut milk and chicken stock together. Put the lamb shoulder into a large baking dish and pour over the mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep lamb

recipeInstructions.text: Turn lamb fat side down, add the onion, cinnamon sticks, star anise and potatoes to the dish. Cover with foil and roast for 1h.
recipeInstructions.name: Start roasting

recipeInstructions.text: Lower the heat to 180C and then roast for another 2-3h. Remove foil, check the lamb is fall apart tender. If not, keep cooking covered. If fall apart, turn the lamb fat side up, baste and bake for a further 30 minutes to get nice crusty bits made amazing thanks to the maillard reaction.
recipeInstructions.name: Slow cook

recipeInstructions.text: Skim off excess fat before serving with fresh coriander and fresh chilis.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: Amazingly simple, really great with rice or just with the potatoes. Also like it with broccolini baked with it.
Best curry paste to use is Maesri but others will do if you don't have a choice.
No need to change the quantities if increasing or decreasing the amount of meat. You'll end up with glorious amounts of gravy regardless.
